intro: Dorstenia digitifolia, commonly known as the fingerleaf woodspurge, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its unique, finger-like leaves that are often arranged in a spiral pattern. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Dorstenia digitifolia is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its ornamental value has made it a popular choice for indoor and greenhouse cultivation.
